sanskrit_verse:
ते पृष्टास्तु यथा ब्रूयुः सीमासंधिषु लक्षणम् ।
तत्तथा स्थापयेद्राजा धर्मेण ग्रामयोर्द्वयोः ॥ ८.२६१॥
transliteration: te pṛṣṭāstu yathā brūyuḥ sīmāsaṃdhiṣu lakṣaṇam | tattathā sthāpayedrājā dharmeṇa grāmayordvayoḥ || 8.261||
sph_interpretive_translation: When questioned, the boundary markers shall declare the signs of territorial junction; the king shall establish accordingly, by Dharma, between two villages.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the declarative integrity of established boundaries
Causation arises from clear demarcation and mutual recognition
Capacity-based responsibility lies with the sovereign to align territory with Dharma
Restoration logic requires harmonization of contested spaces through conscious witnessing
Consciousness alignment occurs when jurisdiction reflects cosmic order
executable_legal_axioms: IF boundary dispute EXISTS THEN consult fixed landmarks AS declared by local testimony
IF testimonial consensus CONFIRMS landmark THEN sovereign MUST align territorial division WITH Dharmic principle
IF village boundaries OVERLAP THEN initiate completion process TO restore clarity OF spatial dharma
IF king receives conflicting claims THEN validate based ON witnessed continuity OF settled markers
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, territorial disputes must invoke foundational witness structures—landmarks or long-standing customs—as primary pramāṇa. The court assumes a mediating role to ensure alignment with Dharmic geography rather than punitive settlement.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is derived from visible, enduring markers that reflect anupūrvaśaḥ—the natural unfolding of settled space. Responsibility is proportional to the capacity of the ruler to uphold clarity. There is no fault assigned; only realignment toward harmony.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate witnessing protocol where elders affirm boundary signs
Restore spatial integrity through ritual marking aligned with seasonal rhythms
Realign village councils to reaffirm shared understanding of limits
Engage king's representatives to embody neutrality during re-establishment
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: boundaries are reflections of consciousness made manifest. Disputes dissolve when Dharma governs perception. Reality is non-punitive; consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
